image.altText: A woman with a serious expression on her face.

props.synopsis: Danielle Bensky was waiting for the bathroom at a New York nightclub when a woman asked if she'd be interested in massaging her client — a wealthy financier named Jeffrey Epstein.

title.children: As more Epstein victims speak out, the American people feel 'played' by Donald Trump

image.altText: A young boy holding an empty pot waiting for food.

props.synopsis: There's an old adage in the media about journalists not wanting to become the story. But the lack of food inside Gaza means journalists and the story are intrinsically linked in a battle for survival.

title.children: 'He has lost 34kg': Why the Gaza story will become harder to tell

image.altText: A truck carrying a multiple rocket launcher.

props.synopsis: At least 11 Thai civilians, including a boy, have been killed in escalating border clashes, the Thai government says.

title.children: At least 11 Thai civilians killed in border conflict, says government

image.altText: A Qatar Airways Airbus A350-900 on the tarmac on a lightly cloudy day.

props.synopsis: Five women who were subjected to strip searches at Doha airport in 2020 have won the right to pursue legal action against Qatar Airways and the airport operator.

title.children: Partial victory for women subjected to internal strip searches in Qatar

image.altText: a female students at an exam table

props.synopsis: An RBA paper suggests the rapid growth in foreign students post-pandemic did not play a big role in pushing rents higher.

title.children: International students have not driven rents and inflation higher, RBA says

image.altText: An Chinese Australian man in his late 30s

props.synopsis: Siang Lu has won the Miles Franklin Literary Award for his book Ghost Cities, about a Chinese translator who loses his job because he can't speak Mandarin.

title.children: Siang Lu's book languished in a drawer for years. Now it's won $60,000

image.altText: An older man with a moustache, wearing a suit, smiling.

props.synopsis: Former star of the screen and stage Henri Szeps has died after a battle with Alzheimer's disease.

title.children: Star of ABC's Mother and Son Henri Szeps dies aged 81

image.altText: Sign showing Ramsay

props.synopsis: Ramsay Health Care are set to close 17 of their 20 psychology clinics across the country potentially leaving thousands of vulnerable patients in limbo.

title.children: Ramsay Health to close majority of its psychology clinics

image.altText: David Littleproud stands behind Kevin Hogan at a press conference

props.synopsis: After repeatedly arguing it wouldn't trade away biosecurity standards to assuage Trump, the government now argues it is satisfied with improvements in US cattle traceability.

title.children: 'To appease Donald Trump': Australia's beef backflip all-too convenient

image.altText: GettyImages-2225961250

props.synopsis: Hawthorn face Carlton at the MCG in beloved Blue Sam Docherty's last game at AFL level. Follow live.

title.children: Fans to farewell beloved veteran at the MCG

image.altText: Accused graffiti artist Jack Gibson-Burrell enters court wearing a Spiderman mask, flanked by his lawyer

props.synopsis: The alleged creator of the Pam the Bird graffiti tag is facing dozens of additional charges, and has grabbed attention by exiting court sporting a Spiderman costume.

title.children: Alleged 'Pam the Bird' creator dons Spiderman costume,  faces 208 charges

image.altText: A red Bendigo Bank sign.

props.synopsis: Bendigo Bank announces it will be shutting down its agency model that allowed customers to access banking services from smaller locations such as newsagencies, citing "decreasing customer use" as a factor.

title.children: Bendigo Bank to close 28 agency locations due to decreasing use

image.altText: Water bubbles as a car passes in the background during flooding from a king tide in early 2024.

props.synopsis: The World Court's climate change decision has been hailed a "planetary scale" win for climate advocates pushing for stronger action against carbon pollution.

title.children: A climate 'reckoning' just unfolded at the World Court. What happened?

image.altText: The side of a sketch of Donna Nelson's head.

props.synopsis: Tokyo's High Court has rejected expert evidence lawyers hoped would overturn drug trafficking charges against Perth grandmother Donna Nelson.

title.children: Tokyo court rejects key evidence in jailed Perth grandmother's appeal bid

image.altText: A composite photo featuring US president Donald Trump and a cooked piece of steak.

props.synopsis: Australia lifts its biosecurity restrictions on US beef imports, one of the Trump administration's key trade grievances, but the industry does not believe it will change much for consumers.

title.children: Cattle industry says shoppers unlikely to see US beef imports on shelves

image.altText: A white-underside humpback whale tail is visible above the surface

props.synopsis: Two whales have been spotted swimming up the Yarra River and under the West Gate Bridge, in what experts describe as a "rare" occurrence.

title.children: 'Quite a mystery' as whales spotted frolicking in Port Phillip Bay

image.altText: A huge tree lies across a road in a suburban area

props.synopsis: Residents say a freak tornado that ripped through Perth's coastal suburbs sounded "like a jet engine" as it fell trees and tore up the roofs of homes.

title.children: Freak tornado 'like a jet engine' damages homes in Perth

image.altText: columbia uni

props.synopsis: Columbia University says it will pay the Trump administration over $330 million to restore federal research money that was cancelled in the name of combating antisemitism on campus.

title.children: Columbia agrees to pay $332m settlement to restore US federal funding

image.altText: A man in a fluro vest folding his arms and standing in a driveway

props.synopsis: Mitchell Forth, one of those found guilty of killing 15-year-old Perth schoolboy Cassius Turvey, is seeking leave to appeal his manslaughter conviction, court documents reveal.

title.children: Cassius Turvey killer seeks appeal against manslaughter conviction

image.altText: A child sits on a wall with a bike nearby

props.synopsis: A new report from Victoria Legal Aid reveals a rise in the number of children being placed on violence intervention orders, with some as young as 10 years old.

title.children: 'How does this help?' Families fight intervention orders forced on their child

image.altText: A composite image of four fair-skinned men, three of whom are in military uniform.

props.synopsis: Prosecutors have cited a lack of evidence behind a decision not to charge defence over the 2023 Taipan helicopter crash which claimed the lives of four men.

title.children: 'Defeated and broken': No charges to be laid over fatal helicopter crash

image.altText: Emily Chancellor of Australia looks on, smiling, wearing a tracksuit

props.synopsis: Emily Chancellor will captain the Wallaroos for the first time as Australia face Wales in Brisbane.

title.children: 'Natural leader' Chancellor to captain Australia for the first time

image.altText: The Tesla brand logo.

props.synopsis: Tesla's electric vehicle business faces challenges before its move into autonomous technology ramps up, but boss Elon Musk is touting its long-term value.

title.children: Tesla posts biggest revenue drop in decade as 'rough few quarters' loom

image.altText: Rob Valetini of the Wallabies running at training

props.synopsis: Melbourne-born Rob Valetini and 32-Test player Will Skelton have been named in the Wallabies' starting side for the second Test against the British and Irish Lions at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

title.children: Big guns return for Wallabies in must-win Test against Lions

image.altText: Michele Bullock at microphone podium with blue screen behind her.

props.synopsis: Reserve Bank governor Michele Bullock says despite last month's surprise jump in the unemployment rate, the numbers matched the RBA's recent forecasts from May.

title.children: RBA governor says June's unemployment rate jump not a shock

image.altText: A woman smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Grace Passfield’s family and friends thought she’d be excited to finish her Melanoma treatment, but the young mother says she was anxious and terrified.

title.children: 'I was terrified': How finishing cancer treatment can feel for survivors

image.altText: Myron Mann Bedford CEO

props.synopsis: Disability support service and employer Bedford will go into voluntary administration in the coming days which will impact 1,400 people living with disability in South Australia.

title.children: Disability employment provider Bedford to go into voluntary administration

image.altText: The outside of a Land Council building

props.synopsis: One of the largest Aboriginal Land Councils in NSW says it has been cleared of any wrongdoing, but will implement several changes to the way it operates.

title.children: Aboriginal Land Council cleared of allegations of mismanagement

image.altText: Hand Showing a scoop of green powder near green beverage.

props.synopsis: Green powders might seem like the answer to lacklustre veggie consumption, but are they actually worth taking?

title.children: What experts have to say about trendy green powders

image.altText: Four Indigenous leaders standing outside of Parliament.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's four Aboriginal land councils have issued a rare joint statement, accusing the NT government of ignoring the human rights of Aboriginal people.

title.children: 'So disgusting': NT land councils issue warning against territory government

image.altText: A man posing alongside a young girl. Both are smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: The UK tech tycoon Mike Lynch, who died last year when his luxury yacht sank in Sicily, had always maintained his innocence.

title.children: Court rules Mike Lynch's estate and former Autonomy partner owe HP over $1b

image.altText: Two middle aged men in suits

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian Liberals say Labor should concede the Tasmanian election, as both parties continue discussions with crossbenchers.

title.children: Liberals call on Labor to concede Tasmanian election but Winter fights back

image.altText: Signs outside a courthouse read "Supreme Court" and "District Court".

props.synopsis: An unnamed hospital applied to the Supreme Court for orders after being asked to perform a surgical termination for the child who was about nine weeks pregnant.

title.children: Supreme Court gives hospital permission to terminate 12yo's pregnancy

image.altText: Rows of babies in cardboard boxes strapped into the seats of a commercial aeroplane.

props.synopsis: In the closing weeks of the Vietnam War, hundreds of orphaned babies and children were airlifted to Australia for a new life, but not all of them were adopted.

title.children: In 1975, hundreds of babies were put in boxes and flown to Australia
